definition: traditional Hakka communal residence in Fujian, typically a large multi-story circular structure built around a central shrine
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: The larger ones, three or four stories high, have wooden stairs connecting the floors.
sentences.chinese: 稍大一些的土樓有三或四層樓高，有木製的樓梯連接。

sentences.english: Tulou building usually consists of rammed earth outer wall and internal wooden framework.
sentences.chinese: 土樓建築通常由夯土外牆和內部木製結構組成。

sentences.english: The design pulls from the idea of the Chinese tulou and the Hakka house.
sentences.chinese: 這個設計來源於中國的土樓和客家房屋。

sentences.english: This is one of the out-of-use earth buildings in a remote village.(This photo and caption were submitted to My Shot.)
sentences.chinese: 這是一所落在遙遠村莊裏不再被使用的土樓。

sentences.english: Earthen houses and temples are mainstream buildings and there is less independent landscape creation.
sentences.chinese: 興造以土樓民居和寺廟爲主流，較少獨立園林創作。

sentences.english: In the center is an ancestral altar, which is common to tulou.
sentences.chinese: 中心爲祖堂，這是土樓的傳統。

sentences.english: A tulou building usually consists of packed earth on the outer wall and a wooden internal framework.
sentences.chinese: 土樓通常由生土夯築而成，內部爲木製結構。

sentences.english: Hakka Earth Building is a circular model of residential living.
sentences.chinese: 圓形土樓是客家人居住的典範民居。

sentences.english: The outer walls, made of rammed earth, protected against bandits.
sentences.chinese: 土樓的外牆由夯土砌成，用於防止土匪的騷擾。

sentences.english: The outermost ring is the main residential section of the tulou.
sentences.chinese: 最外面的一圈是土樓的住宅區。

definition: Wulai township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
Arishang Nahiyisi or Wenquan county in Börtala Mongol autonomous prefecture 博爾塔拉蒙古自治州|博尔塔拉蒙古自治州, Xinjiang
Yalong Bay in Sanya 三亞|三亚[San1 ya4], Hainan
Yuanshan township in Yilan county 宜蘭縣|宜兰县[Yi2 lan2 xian4], Taiwan
Paiwan, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan
Chihkan Tower (formerly Fort Provintia) in Tainan, Taiwan (also written 赤嵌樓|赤嵌楼[Chi4 kan3 lou2])
